posts.cooked: Hello.  We switched out our rio1 for a rio2.  Trying to format it following the instructions.  Cannot find the rio2 image for 2023.  Tried reinstalling the NI tools.  Still no image.  Only the rio1 image.  Thanks.

posts.name: Ari Meles-Braverman
posts.cooked:
Make sure you’re following the imaging steps for the roboRIO 2, which are different than the roboRIO 1

The NI roboRIO 2.0 boots from a microSD card configured with an appropriate boot image containing the NI Linux Real-Time OS, drivers, and libraries specific to FRC. The microSD card must be imaged ...

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO 2 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: Thanks.  Yes, we are following the roboRIO2 steps.  But there is no Rio2 image when we click on the SD box.  Only the rio1 file.

posts.name: Ari Meles-Braverman
posts.cooked: Maybe try uninstalling and reinstalling the game tools? If the file got deleted that should put it back

The package manager keeps saying “No Operation to be performed”

posts.name: Ari Meles-Braverman
posts.cooked: Did you uninstall first? If not, the installer will  just say “you already have this installed” instead of doing its job

posts.cooked: Ok.  Didn’t uninstall will try that first.  Thanks.
Do I have to uninstall the driver station, dashboard, and rio tool? Or can I just uninstall the rio tool? Thanks.

I am getting this: image 769×461 111 KB

image 769×461 111 KB

image 769×461 111 KB
Tried a new cable.  Now getting this:

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
From the above linked doc:

Imaging the roboRIO 2 directly with the roboRIO Imaging Tool is not supported.

Use the Balena Etcher method to write the SD card directly from the PC instead (eg not using the RoboRIO).
I really appreciate the help. It now looks like the rio has the image. But when I try to enter the team number using the imaging tool it came back with an error.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Try using the “roboRIO Team Number Setter” tool that comes with WPILib (it should be in the 2023 WPILib Tools folder on the desktop if you’ve installed WPILib).
Thanks will try that now.

I sure appreciate your help.  Just tried number setter.  Still doesn’t look like the number took. image 839×562 22.2 KB

image 839×562 22.2 KB

image 839×562 22.2 KB

Actually, I just blinked and rebooted it a couple of times and it looks like it is there. image 1034×330 75.4 KB Thanks so much! Really appreciate you sticking with this!!

image 1034×330 75.4 KB

image 1034×330 75.4 KB
Hello.  I am now getting a red com light on the rio.   The driver station says there is com.

posts.name: Sara Robertson
posts.cooked: A red com light indicates that there is no robot code running on the rio, which is consistent with the screenshot of the driver station you posted. You must redeploy code after you maging the rio.
